data.name: Application Server Boundary
data.description:
The web application server trusts the client for basic UI interactions but not for data 
integrity or authorization decisions

data.name: Third-party Service Boundary
data.description: Third-party services are external and partially trusted; communication channels are secured but data received from them is validated

data.name: Frontend UI
data.description: Runs on the user’s browser (React/Vue). Handles browsing, cart, and order submission. All inputs validated by backend.

threats.title: [T-001] Customer Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate a legitimate customer to place fraudulent orders or access their order history.
threats.mitigation:
• Enforce strong authentication and session management (bcrypt hashes, JWT with short expiry).
• Use HTTPS only and secure cookies.
• Implement multi-factor authentication for staff and optionally for customers.
• Lock accounts after repeated failed logins.

threats.title: [T-003] Web Application Server Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker might set up a fraudulent web server to phish user credentials or intercept data.
threats.mitigation:
Use valid TLS certs
Enable HSTS & certificate pinning
Verify API domains via CORS
Educate users about URL integrity.

data.name: Customer
data.description: External user placing and paying for coffee orders.

data.name: Web App Server
data.description: Node.js backend handling authentication, order logic, payments, and DB communication.

threats.title: [T-001] Customer Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker could impersonate a legitimate customer to place fraudulent orders or access their order history.
threats.mitigation:
• Enforce strong authentication and session management (bcrypt hashes, JWT with short expiry).
• Use HTTPS only and secure cookies.
• Implement multi-factor authentication for staff and optionally for customers.
• Lock accounts after repeated failed logins.

threats.title: [T-003] Web Application Server Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker might set up a fraudulent web server to phish user credentials or intercept data.
threats.mitigation:
Use valid TLS certs
Enable HSTS & certificate pinning
Verify API domains via CORS
Educate users about URL integrity.

data.name: Payment Gateway
data.description: External third-party service for secure payment processing. Communication secured via HTTPS/TLS.

data.name: MongoDB Database
data.description: Trusted persistent storage for users, orders, and payments.

data.name: Order Interaction
data.description: User input and actions (browse, edit, submit)

data.name: Sends Log in request
data.description: Sends the login details from the frontend UI

data.name: Returns log in response
data.description:
Returns the response to the login request.

If the web app was able to verify and authenticate the user login, it directs the user to the page corresponding to their user type:
Customer - Order page
Barista - View orders page
Manager - Sales reports page
Admin - Edit menu page

Else, the response sent will be an error

data.name: Sends order details
data.description: All inputs (items, prices, delivery info) validated by backend.

data.name: Return list of pending orders
data.description: Returns the list of orders with status pending to the frontend ui

Client side is untrusted, therefore, all input originating from there must be validated by the web app server. Web app server trusts the client for basic UI interactions but not for data integrity or authorization

data.name: Queries order data
data.description: Web app sends a query for relevant order data
